description: From Latin aequābilis, from aequō (“make level”), from aequus (“even, level”).

adjectives.description: equable (comparative more equable, superlative most equable)

entries.meaning: Unvarying, calm and steady; constant and uniform.
examples: Turning to the prisoner, "Budd," he said, and scarce in equable tones, "Budd, if you have aught further to say for yourself, say it now."

entries.meaning: (of temperature) Free from extremes of heat or cold.
(of emotions etc) Not easily disturbed; tranquil.
